item.title: MagniFinger
item.description: MagniFinger Abstract MagniFinger is a fingertip-worn microscopy device that augments the limited abilities of human visual and tactile sensory systems in micrometer-scale environments. MagniFinger makes use of the finger’s dexterous motor skills to achieve precise and intuitive control while allowing the user to observe the desired position by placing a fingertip. To implement the fingertip-sized device and its tactile display, we have built a system comprising a ball lens, an image sensor, and a thin piezoelectric actuator.

item.title: Temari
item.description: Temari Abstract To provide cultural night experiences with tourists in Kanazawa City, we have developped and exhibited our interactive digital installation titled “Temari and Shadow” at the open space of the 21st Century Museum of Contemporary Art, Kanazawa. Our installation utilizes shadows cast by people standing in front of a projector. We chose Kanazawa’s Kaga Temari, a hand-sized colorful toy ball made of thread, as a motif of this work.
